Direzione o partecipazione a comitati ed.content: Scientific Coordinator _ To-India Summer School_ University of Turin (Since 2015 the Department of Cultures, Politics and Society runs the Summer School on Politics, Development and Social Change in Contemporary India. Among others, the Summer School hosted lectures by: Jan Breman, Barbara Harriss-White, CP Chandrashekar, Jayati Ghosh, Ravinder Kaur, Subir Sinha).
Membro della redazione di Quaderni Storici, rivista di storia sociale di fascia "A".

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: “Vibrant Gujarat: subnational ethos and the rise of an exclusive model of development in Narendra Modi’s Gujarat (2001 – 2011)”, paper presented at the Biennial International Conference of the Gujarat Studies Association, Dubai.

“The will to appear global: urban development, marginality and territorial transformation in the narratives of slum dwellers of Ahmedabad (West India)”, paper presented at the international conference Rising Asia, Anxious Europe, organised by the Asia Dynamic Initiative, University of Copenhagen, Denmark.

“Suspended Citizenship and Denied Membership: the exclusion of Muslims from the urban space of Ahmedabad after the 2002 pogroms”, paper presented at the international workshop on Citizenship and Citizenship rights at times of war, crisis, and transition (19th and 20th centuries), supported by the Fondazione Giuseppe Siotto, Alghero, Italy.
"Multiple Citizenship, Denied Belonging and Communal Violence in post-colonial India" _ Guest Lecture in the Course of "Cultural Mediation", Bocconi University, Milan, Italy.

“Two unsolved problems of Independent India: mass violence and the representation of disadvantaged groups”, paper presented at the seminar “Majority/Minorities: which future for democracy in South Asia?”, University of Napoli L’Orientale, Neaples, Italy.

“The encounter of the colonial and the local in the construction of a prospective colonial metropolis: Migration, Citizenship, and Epidemics in Ahmedabad, India (1812-1870).”, paper presented at the Social History Society Conference, Portsmouth, UK.

Organizer of the international workshop: "Turin and Elsewhere, Cross-disciplinary debates on urban transformations and dynamics" with the participation of 20 early career scholars who came to present from across the world and a key-note speech by Professor Loic Wacquant.

Organizer of the workshop “Il desiderio di essere globali: citta', lavoro e marginalizzazione nel XX secolo” (The will to appear global: cities, labour and marginalisation in the XX century), as part of the Annual Symposium of the Journal Zapruder: Storie in Movimento.
“Labour and the City, a continuous interdependence (Ahmedabad, 1900-2000)”, paper presented at the first Conference of the European Labour History Network, Turin, Italy.

“Re-signifying Places: Changing Community Balances and Urban Geographies after the Partition of India and Pakistan”, paper presented at the European Social Science History Conference, Valencia, Spain.

In October 2016 I was one of the three Italian delegates invited to the Symposium "Power Structures, Conflict Resoluon and Social Justice", organised by the EU-India Social Science and Humanities Platform (EqUIP) in New Delhi, India.

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Arts and Humanities Research Council, UK _ Doctoral Fellowship
Fellow of the Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland
Fellow of the Gujarat Studies Association
Accademia dei Lincei and British Academy _ Fellowship
Fondazione Fondo Ricerca Talenti (Fondazione Cassa di Risparmio di Torino) _ Workshop Grant 2015

Review of my monograph "Urbanisation, Citizenship and Conflict in India. Ahmedabad 1900-2000" on the international network H-Net, with highly positive comments. https://networks.h-net.org/no de/4089/reviews/147693/kedzior-bobbio-ur banisation-citizenship-and-conflict-indi a-ahmedabad

Specifiche esperienze professionali cara.content: Director of the Events Office _ Asiatica Film Festival, Rome, Italy. (Coordinator of the Events Office and Editor of the Festival catalogue. Organiser of the “Asia di Carta” initiative. Advisor for Indian literature and for the relationship with Indian authors, film-makers, and producers).

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Member of the board of the interdisciplinary and interdepartmental Research Project Cittadinanze / Citizenships of the Campus Einaudi, University of Turin (http://campuscittadinanze.eu/), which coordinates activities across the departments CPS, Economics and Law on themes related to practices and conceptions of citizenship (legal and cultural), migration, integration and cultural understanding.

Part of the interdisciplinary research group “Metropolis in Asia” of five early career researchers working on urban change, culture and exclusion in Asian cities (Universities of Turin, Neaples l'Orientale, Macerata, Rome)
Part of the interdisciplinary Working group on Free and Unfree Labour, within the European Labour History Network.

Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Lecturer of Modern and Contemporary History of South Asia, within the BA course in "Languages and Cultures of Asia and Africa" (6 cfu).
